intro: Pilosella cymigera, commonly known as the clustered pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers surrounded by pale green bracts, which give it a pearly appearance. Pilosella cymigera is often found in meadows, grasslands, and rocky slopes, thriving in well-drained soils. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves.
